summary: This is an FBI Laboratory case record (Lab #2020-01577) detailing forensic questioned document examinations. The case involves analyzing a greeting card and envelope addressed to Larry Nassar, comparing them against documents purported to contain the known handwriting of Jeffrey Epstein. The examiner concludes meaningful comparisons could not be conducted due to a lack of verified, comparable known writing samples. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons records related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at MCC New York in July 2019, including his medical status, commissary lists, an incident report of a suicide attempt, and disciplinary hearing notices. It also includes an FBI Laboratory case file (2020-01577) concerning a questioned documents examination of items possibly linked to Epstein, including a greeting card and envelope addressed to Larry Nassar. This document consists of two parts: a series of product catalog pages from 'artefacto.com' dated September 8, 2014, and an email exchange between FBI agents on August 11, 2020, regarding the submission and processing of evidence (Lab #2020-01577, case NY-3151227) to the FBI Laboratory's Questioned Documents Unit. This document is a collection of FBI internal emails, a laboratory examination request, and related forms concerning a forensic handwriting analysis. The FBI's Questioned Documents Unit is attempting to determine if a letter addressed to Larry Nassar, found as 'return to sender' at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, was written by Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence reveals difficulties in obtaining verified handwriting samples from Epstein for comparison.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The case involves examining documents submitted as bearing his purported known writing for comparison with questioned items. He is listed as an inmate (Register No. 76318-054) in Bureau of Prisons records.

persons.name: Larry Nassar
persons.context: The person to whom the letter in question was addressed. The letter was returned to the Metropolitan Correctional Center as he was no longer at the Tucson, Arizona, prison address.

persons.name: Beaudourn, Rotron
persons.context: Appears as the staff member who generated a Bureau of Prisons Health Services document for Jeffrey Epstein on July 30, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the Bureau of Prisons records; an inmate at MCC New York (Register No. 76318-054) who was involved in a suicide attempt incident on July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Robert Morrison
persons.context: Bureau of Prisons staff member who signed off on Epstein's medical duty status record on July 30, 2019.

persons.name: Siva
persons.context: Bureau of Prisons staff member who responded with another officer to the noise from Epstein's cell during the July 23, 2019 incident.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cell mate (Register No. 78514-054) who was at the cell door stating Epstein had attempted to hang himself during the July 23, 2019 incident.

persons.name: Anderson
persons.context: Bureau of Prisons staff who arrived after the initial response to the July 23, 2019 incident involving Epstein.

persons.name: Eklund
persons.context: A counselor at Metropolitan Correctional Center, Unit 7 South, listed as a contact for visitor application forms.

persons.name: Donald
persons.context: Mentioned in the evidence inventory as the name beginning a piece of paper ('AutHoR DONALD...') found in Jeffrey Epstein's cell, from which ESDA lifts were taken.

persons.name: Jhonny Contreras

persons.name: Jijonny Contreras

persons.context: Mentioned in the evidence inventory as the name beginning a piece of paper ('JIJONNY CONTReRAS...') found in Jeffrey Epstein's cell, from which ESDA lifts were taken.

connections.description: The document examines whether Epstein wrote a greeting card and envelope addressed to Nassar, implying a potential connection, though the nature is not specified.
Were housed together in cell 124 in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York as of July 23, 2019.
S/O Siva was one of the officers who responded to the incident in Epstein's cell on July 23, 2019.
Ops Lt. Anderson arrived on scene during the response to the July 23, 2019 incident.
Robert Morrison, as Health Services Staff, signed off on Epstein's medical duty status record.
An envelope addressed to Larry Nassar was submitted to the FBI Lab as part of an examination possibly linked to Epstein's known writing.
SA G. received a phone call from Lt. Doctor regarding the discovery of the Nassar letter, initiating the forensic examination.
SA G. is the investigating agent attempting to obtain verified handwriting samples from Epstein for forensic comparison.

events.title: FBI Questioned Documents Examination
events.description: The FBI Laboratory conducts forensic analysis on items including a greeting card to Larry Nassar and documents purported to be Jeffrey Epstein's writing. The examination includes handwriting analysis and Electrostatic Detection Apparatus (ESDA) tests for indented writing.

events.title: Bureau of Prisons Health Services Record
events.description: A medical duty status report is generated for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Register No. 76318-054) at the New York MCC, noting housing status and equipment.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt in MCC New York
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, officers responded to noise from Epstein's cell (SHU M-Tier Cell 124). His cell mate stated Epstein had attempted to hang himself with an orange homemade rope. Epstein was breathing but unresponsive when found.

events.title: Epstein Medical Duty Status and DHO Hearing Notice
events.description: Epstein was on complete bed rest with bathroom privileges only. A Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO) hearing was scheduled for the same date regarding the July 23 incident, charged with 'Tattooing or Self-Mutilation' (Code 228).

events.title: FBI Laboratory Submission of Evidence
events.description: The FBI Laboratory received Submission 1 for Case #2020-01577, including electronic images of a greeting card and envelope addressed to Larry Nassar, and documents bearing Epstein's purported known writing.

events.title: FBI Laboratory Submission of Original Evidence
events.description: The FBI Laboratory received Submission 2, containing the original physical envelope addressed to 'Larry Nassar' and a greeting card.

events.title: FBI Evidence Coordination for Lab #2020-01577
events.description: Email exchange between FBI agents regarding the shipment of evidence (Serial 183, Serial 147, Lead 4) to the FBI Laboratory's Questioned Documents Unit for case NY-3151227.

events.title: Product Catalog Browsing
events.description: Multiple timestamps show browsing activity on the website artefacto.com, viewing various furniture product categories (lounge chairs, coffee tables, sofas, etc.).

events.title: Letter to Nassar Postmarked
events.description: A letter addressed to Larry Nassar is postmarked. It was later returned to the Metropolitan Correctional Center as 'return to sender'.

events.title: BOP Informs FBI of Letter
events.description: BOP SIS Lieutenant Tijuana Doctor calls FBI SA G. to report the 'return to sender' letter addressed to Larry Nassar that was received by the MCC.

events.title: FBI Submits Laboratory Examination Request
events.description: The FBI New York Field Office formally requests the FBI Laboratory's Questioned Documents Unit to perform a handwriting analysis on the Nassar letter.

events.title: FBI Lab Acknowledges Case Receipt
events.description: The FBI Laboratory's Questioned Documents Unit acknowledges receipt of the evidence, assigning it Lab #2020-01577 and Case ID NY-3151227.

events.title: Evidence Shipped Back to New York
events.description: The FBI Laboratory ships the evidence back to the New York Field Office, as the examiner could not proceed due to lack of comparable, verified handwriting samples from Epstein.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, 150 Park Row, New York, N.Y. 10007
Special Housing Unit (SHU), M-Tier, Cell 124, MCC New York
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), Manhattan, NYC, NY 10007
9300 S. Wilmot Road, Tucson, Arizona, 85756 (Federal Bureau of Prisons facility)
FBI Laboratory, 2501 Investigation Parkway, Quantico, VA 22135
FBI New York Field Office, 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: The FBI attempted to determine if Jeffrey Epstein wrote a greeting card and envelope addressed to former sports doctor Larry Nassar.
The examination was inconclusive because the submitted 'known' writing samples of Epstein were not verified and contained multiple writers/styles, making meaningful comparison impossible.
Indented writing of unknown value was found on some of Epstein's purported documents and preserved as secondary evidence.
Jeffrey Epstein's inmate register number was 76318-054, and he was housed at the New York MCC as of July 2019.
The document includes a Bureau of Prisons record showing Epstein was on 'complete bed rest' and had a CPAP machine as of July 30, 2019.
On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his MCC New York cell after an apparent suicide attempt using an orange homemade rope; he was breathing but unresponsive.

Epstein was charged by the Bureau of Prisons with a prohibited act (Code 228: Tattooing or Self-Mutilation) following the July 23 incident and was scheduled for a Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO) hearing.
Epstein's medical status on July 30, 2019, indicated he was confined to his living quarters on complete bed rest with bathroom privileges only.

The FBI Laboratory (Case #2020-01577) conducted a questioned documents examination on items including an envelope addressed to convicted sex offender Larry Nassar, seeking to compare handwriting to known samples of Jeffrey Epstein.
Bureau of Prisons records show Epstein had a CPAP machine (Serial #: P11312813B1E0) and his commissary spending limit was $100.00 bi-weekly.
The document references FBI Laboratory case #2020-01577, linked to NY case NY-3151227, with evidence submissions including Serial 183, Serial 147, and Lead 4.
An FBI agent from New York confirms the Evidence Unit is shipping item '1A' (with a letter) via FedEx to the Questioned Documents Unit at the FBI Lab.
The email notes a discrepancy: the Lab had only received physical evidence for '1839' and used documents from Serial 147 to begin processing examination requests.
A significant portion of the document consists of product catalog page captures from 'artefacto.com', all timestamped September 8, 2014, around 8:00-8:45 PM.
The correspondence is focused on logistical coordination for forensic document analysis related to an ongoing investigation.
The FBI attempted to determine if Jeffrey Epstein wrote a letter addressed to fellow inmate Larry Nassar while both were in federal custody.

The forensic document examiner concluded the analysis could not proceed due to a lack of verified, comparable handwriting samples from Epstein, as many documents from his cell may have been written by assistants.
The letter was postmarked August 13, 2019, and returned to the MCC because Nassar was no longer at the Tucson address.
Evidence submitted included the questioned letter, a greeting card, and documents from Epstein's cell (including papers mentioning 'Donald' and 'Jijonny Contreras').
The examination was requested in part because evidence might be needed for a trial scheduled to begin in early January 2021.
